Class CacheDemon

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--CacheDemon
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class CacheDemon
extends java.lang.Thread

Manages the cache. All tasks should access data through this class. The CacheDemon should be the only one accessing the MulReader.
The demon implements following tasks:

  • All other tasks access data through it, it forwards the request to the skin reader and then stores the result in cache.
  • The cache is build up by a set of hash tables, keyed mostly by the id of the tile, or it's location.
  • If a tile is already cached it has not to be read. (duh, of course)
  • If memory usage exceeds the limit specified by umelange.ini it simply flushes all cache. This turned out to be more effictive than the history tracking algorithm that was first implemented. However it used Vectors to store history, so it was quite ineffective. If linked list (maybe pooled?) would be used it could be catched up again.
There would also be a possibility to uses "weak references" to have the garbage collector worry about history and deletion. But it seems the weak references are only supported by JDK 1.2, since UMelange is JDK 1.1 compatible ...
